Description: The Temptation of St Antony; St Antony stands partially draped in the centre, with two temptresses and two devils surrounding him; the two either side of him frantically pull at his drapery; above God the Father flies down to his rescue; in the lower right corner is a wild boar; after Tintoretto. 1582 Engraving
Curator's comments: Plate described in 'Tintoretto e suoi incisori', Milan, 1994, cat. No.1, page 19-20. This is the second state, with Forma's address.
Bibliographic references: Bohlin 1979 / Prints and related drawings by the Carracci family (101.I)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Dr Charles Sloman
Acquisition notes: Registered separately in Josi's Nn register as an individual item with the register number Nn,7.34
